io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets

Enum TextTable.Box

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<TextTable.Box>
      • io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets.TextTable.Box
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextTable.Style, Serializable, Comparable<TextTable.Box>
    Enclosing class:
    TextTable

    public static enum TextTable.Box
extends Enum<TextTable.Box>
implements TextTable.Style

    Preset styles, specifying the characters used to draw the lines and corners of a table. As of now, the whole table is drawn with the same set of characters (we don't allow to customize per row or per cell).

    You don't need to use this class if you prefer to provide your own styles.

    See Also:
    TextTable.presetBox(Style)

      ...but how about drawing rectangles with rounded corners? Can we do that now, too?

      • horizontal

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @NotNull
public @NotNull String horizontal()
        Description copied from interface: TextTable.Style
        Determines the characters used to draw the horizontal lines of a table.
        Specified by:
        horizontal in interface TextTable.Style
        Returns:
        horizontal line string. If multiple characters, will be repeated and trimmed as required to reach the desired size.
        See Also:
        TextTable.style, TextTable.presetBox(Style)

      • vertical

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @NotNull
public @NotNull String vertical()
        Description copied from interface: TextTable.Style
        Determines the characters used to draw the vertical lines of a table.
        Specified by:
        vertical in interface TextTable.Style
        Returns:
        vertical line string. If multiple characters, the column separators will be using the whole string (make sure to have matching T-joints and cross-joints).
        See Also:
        TextTable.style, TextTable.presetBox(Style)

      • joints

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @NotNull
public @NotNull String[] joints(int row)
        Description copied from interface: TextTable.Style
        Determines the characters used to draw the joints and corners of a table. The joints are defined as a virtual 3x3 array, with values as follows: 
         String[][] joints = {
     { TOP_LEFT_CORNER    , TOP_T_JOINT    , TOP_RIGHT_CORNER    },
     { LEFT_T_JOINT       , CROSS_JOINT    , RIGHT_T_JOINT       },
     { BOTTOM_LEFT_CORNER , BOTTOM_T_JOINT , BOTTOM_RIGHT_CORNER },
 }
        Specified by:
        joints in interface TextTable.Style
        Parameters:
        row - which row of the 9-box to return.
        Returns:
        array of 3 strings to be used as left corner, center and right-corner for the specified row. See examples in TextTable.Box.
        See Also:
        TextTable.style, TextTable.presetBox(Style)
